tombofthespiderqueen.name: Tomb of the Spider Queen
tombofthespiderqueen.description: Three lane map. One siege camp at the very bottom. Two bruiser camps on the left and right. Boss at the very top.
notes: Unclaimed gems last for 8 seconds.
Channeling an altar takes 6 seconds.
Murky, The Lost Vikings, and Misha each drop 1 gem upon death. All other heroes drop 3 gems upon death. These gems are claimable by the enemy team.
Each hero can hold up to 100 gems. However, The Lost Vikings can hold up to 100 gems each Viking.
Past the 15 minute mark, scaling for Webweavers and their minions jump by 50%.

battlefieldofeternity.name: Battlefield of Eternity
battlefieldofeternity.description: Two lane map. One siege camp at the top, another siege camp at the bottom. Two bruiser camps on the left and right. Immortals spawn in the middle, occupying two of the four circles.
notes: The first Immortal spawn follows some special rules. They always spawn first top and bottom. When the Immortals switch, the Immortals go to the opposite side of the teams' map. So the left team's Immortal will be on the right, and the right team's Immortal will be on the left.
Subsequent Immortal respawn positions are random, but never the same as the previous one.
Immortals switch to a different position when one Immortal reaches half health.
When an Immortal is won, the Immortal enters the strongest enemy lane.
When an Immortal is won, it gains shields equal to the remaining health of the enemy team's Immortal.
In lane, an Immortal has ranged attacks so long as it has shields. Each attack it makes drains shields until it has none. It switches to melee afterward.

The Bruiser camp Shamans spawn and respawn two dogs in lane until it is killed. Shamans can also be healed. Shamans are incredibly effective pushers; it's imperative to kill the Shaman first before the dogs.

blackheartsbay.name: Blackheart's Bay
blackheartsbay.description: Three lane map. Large gap between top/mid and bot. Siege camps at bottom-left and bottom-right. Slightly above each siege camp are Doubloon camps, which do not generate any lane mercenaries upon capture. Three bruiser camps are far-left, far-right, and bot. Near the Watchtower are two more Doubloon camps. The Boss camp is at the very top. Chests spawn in the middle.
notes: Each hero can hold up to 100 doubloons.
Upon death, a hero will drop all their doubloons.
Each captured camp drops 2 doubloons in addition to the Regeneration Globe.
Blackheart himself spawns at 1:15 minutes.
A team must give Blackheart 10 doubloons to have cannonballs attack enemy team structures. Subsequent turn-ins for that team require 2 more doubloons.
Cannonballs deal 2,815 damage each directly to structures. Cannonballs deal 750 splash damage in a small radius around the impact.

Cannonballs attack in this order:
1. Outer mid lane
2. Outer top lane
3. Outer bot lane
4. Inner mid lane
5. Inner top lane
6. Core

The first cannonball volley of the game (regardless of which side fires first) follows special rules if it attacks an outer lane. It will always attack the external towers and gate first before moving onto the fountain and inner tower, then finally the fort.

Within the outer lanes, the cannonball will randomly target the external towers, gate, fountain and inner tower. After that, they will target the fort. Within the inner lanes, the cannonball will randomly target the external towers, gate, and fountain, then randomly target the inner tower and keep. It may be advantageous to destroy inner towers so cannonballs focus the keeps.

Inner fountains have 2,100 health and 700 shields, which equals 2,800 life overall. One cannonball hit should destroy said fountain. However, Tassadar can shield the fountain to force a second cannonball. Outer fountains have only 2,200 life overall, but Tassadar can force a second cannonball if he takes the Reinforce Structure talent at level 1 or if he's level 15.

braxisholdout.name: Braxis Holdout
braxisholdout.description: Two lane map. Beacons at the top and bottom, toward the middle. The Zerg swarms out of the top and bottom pens. Two siege and two bruiser camps total. Boss camp in the very center.
notes: Capturing a beacon takes 3 seconds if it's uncaptured, or 6 seconds if the enemy has captured it.
Beacons progress in intervals of 2%. From 0% to 100% takes roughly 32 seconds, or roughly 3% per second.
The regeneration globes at the top and bottom of the map respawn every 45 seconds.

cursedhollow.name: Cursed Hollow
cursedhollow.description: Three lane map. Two Watchtowers at top-left and bot-right. Two siege camps, two bruiser camps, and two Boss camps total.

timings.Respawn conditions: After the last taken tribute, or after a curse ends.

notes: A curse lasts 70 seconds, and each tribute has a timer of 70 seconds with 20 seconds of variance.
Capturing a tribute takes 6 seconds.
The tributes are pseudo-random and spread across 2 rows (top, bot) and 3 columns (left, mid, right).

Tributes spawn in this order:
1. The first tribute of the game spawns in one of the mid columns.
2. A set of three tributes never repeats columns.
3. A set of three tributes cannot be in the same row.
4. A curse resets rules 2 and 3.

dragonshire.name: Dragon Shire
dragonshire.description: Three lane map. Two siege camps and three bruiser camps total.
notes: The dragon lasts (50 + 2 Ã— each full minute of game time) seconds. So if the game time is 17:54, the dragon will last 84 seconds, or 1:24 minutes.
Capturing an uncaptured shrine takes 4 seconds. If the shrine has been captured by the enemy team, capturing it will take 8 seconds.
Channeling the Dragon Knight statue takes 3 seconds.
That means if an enemy starts re-capturing a shrine just as you start channeling the Dragon Knight statue, you will finish channeling with a second to spare.

gardenofterror.name: Garden of Terror
gardenofterror.description: Three lane map. Four siege camps and two bruiser camps total.
notes: Small seed camps grant 15 seeds. Garden terrors grant 60 seeds. In total, a single night contains 180 seeds.
The pod image next to each team's seed count is either open or closed. If it's closed, there aren't enough seeds remaining for that team to get a terror.

infernalshrines.name: Infernal Shrines
infernalshrines.description: Three lane map. Three siege camps and two bruiser camps. Punisher shrines spawn in one of the three circles in the middle.
notes: Timing is slightly random, and as yet undetermined.
Shrine location is random, but never the same as the previous one.
Punisher type is random, but never the same as the previous one.

The Bruiser camp Shamans spawn and respawn two dogs in lane until it is killed. Shamans can also be healed. Shamans are incredibly effective pushers; it's imperative to kill the Shaman first before the dogs.

skytemple.name: Sky Temple
skytemple.description: Three lane map. Watchtower between top and mid lanes. Two siege camps between bot and mid lanes, on the left and right. Two bruiser camps between top and mid lanes, on the left and right. Another bruiser camp at the very bottom. Boss between bot and mid lanes, in the middle. Temples spawn in the three engraved circles top, mid, and bot.
notes: A single set of temples will not spawn twice in a row.
Three temples never spawn at once.

The temples spawn in this order:
1. Top and mid temples.
2. Bottom temple.
3. Bottom and either top or mid (random).
4. Random number and location.

Each temple has their own individual rules. Generally, a temple's priorities are:
1. Attack outer lanes, starting with their lane. (Middle temple attacks top lane after middle is cleared.)
2. Attack inner lanes, again starting from their lane.
3. Attack core.

Within each group of buildings (e.g. outer mid lane), each temple has special rules. Generally:
1. Attack external towers and gate. The order depends on distance.
2. Attack internal tower, fountain, and fort. The order depends on distance.

This has some implications. For example, top temple will attack top lane's inner tower before the fort, whereas the middle temple will attack the fort first before going to the inner tower. That means top temple will give a slight XP lead if it manages to snag the top inner tower.
The exact attack order for each temple hasn't been confirmed yet, and only incomplete data exists. This data is in the process of being collected and presented.

towersofdoom.name: Towers of Doom
towersofdoom.description: Three lane map. Two siege camps between bot and mid lanes, on the left and right. Another siege camp at the very top. Boss between top and mid lanes.
notes: Timings for Towers of Doom are mostly approximate and not exact.
Capturing an altar takes 6 seconds.
The first and fifth set of altars are always three altars at once. Other sets never respawn as three.
The one-way tunnel from your base to the middle of the battlefield opens at 12:00-13:00 minutes.
When the tunnel opens, all forts upgrade to keeps, including their Kill EXP given.
If you capture all six towers (forts or keeps), your team's Core will periodically fire at the enemy team's Core for one point of damage each.
Captured siege mercenaries that reach the enemy core deal a point of damage each.
Mercenary Lord increases the kamikaze damage siege mercenaries do.
A captured Boss mercenary deals 4 points of damage to the enemy Core instead of spawning a mercenary in lane.

When attacking the boss, a green flying skull occasionally spirals out. If this skull hits a hero, it transforms into a green pool that deals percentage damage within a circle. This percentage damage increases with the length of the game.

warheadjunction.name: Warhead Junction
warheadjunction.description: Three lane map. Two siege camps and two bruiser camps on the left and right. Two Boss camps, one at the very top, and another at the bottom. Nine possible warhead spawn points; three at the bottom, three in middle, three at the top.
notes: 2 or 4 warheads spawn at a time.
Upon death, a hero drops any warhead they may be holding.
The Boss mercenaries seem stronger and act differently than other maps.
